en: A few miles south of Soledad, the Salinas River drops in close to the hillside bank and runs deep and green. The water is warm too, for it has slipped twinkling over the yellow sands in the sunlight before reaching the narrow pool. On one side of the river the golden foothill slopes curve up to the strong and rocky Gabilan mountains, but on the valley side the water is lined with trees—willows fresh and green with every spring, carrying in their lower leaf junctures the debris of the winter’s flooding; and sycamores with mottled, white, recumbent limbs and branches that arch over the pool. On the sandy bank under the trees the leaves lie deep and so crisp that a lizard makes a great skittering if he runs among them. Rabbits come out of the brush to sit on the sand in the evening, and the damp flats are covered with the night tracks of ’coons, and with the spread pads of dogs from the ranches, and with the split–wedge tracks of deer that come to drink in the dark.
vi: I Phía Nam Soledad chừng mấy dặm, dòng sông Salinas đổ xuống theo sát sườn đồi, nước xanh thẳm và ấm nhờ phơi mình trên bãi cát vàng lấp lánh ánh nắng trước khi êm ả chảy vào một cái hồ nhỏ hẹp. Một bên bờ là những sườn đồi vàng ánh nhô lên, soải mình đến tận những vách núi đá Gabilan, bờ sông bên kia cây cỏ um tùm, hễ vào tiết xuân rặng liễu lại xanh rờn và những chiếc lá phía dưới gốc còn giữ dấu vết các trận lụt mùa đông qua, những hàng sung, lá và cành nhẵn thín vươn ra và kết thành một vòm trên mặt nước yên lặng. Trên bãi cát ven sông lá rụng thành một thảm dày và khô làm mỗi khi có con thằn lằn chạy qua, lại gây ra tiếng sột soạt ngân dài. Chiều đến, lũ thỏ từ các bụi rậm ra ngồi chơi trên cát và những chỗ đất thấp mỗi buổi sáng thường hãy còn dấu chân hay vết móng các đàn chuột ăn cá, bầy chó trại hay bầy hươu đã tới uống nước trong đêm.
tr: I Soledad'ın birkaç mil güneyinde Salinas deresi, tepenin yamacını yalayarak yemyeşil ve derin akar. Suyu ılıktır da, çünkü bu dar yatakta durgunlaşmadan önce, sarı kumlar üzerinde güneşten parıldayarak inmiştir. Çayın bir yanında, tepenin yaldızlı sırtları ta Galiban dağlarının kayalık yığınına kadar, kıvrıla büküle çıkar ama, vadi yönünde dere kıyısı ağaçlıktır. Baharla filizi bir renk alan ve alt yapraklarının ortasında, kışın kabaran suların bıraktığı toz toprağın izleri görülen söğütlerle alacalı yaprakları ve dalları uzayarak durgun suyun üstünde bir kubbe kurar frenk çınarları. Kumsal kıyıda, ağaçların altına yapraklar kalın bir halı serer, bu halı öylesine kurudur ki, bir kertenkelenin kaçışı orada, uzun bir çıtırtı yaratır. Akşamları tavşanlar, fundalıklardan çıkarak gelip kumların üstünde otururlar, nemli yerlerde de geceleyin dolaşmış racoonların, kocaman ayaklı çiftlik köpeklerinin ve karanlıkta su içmeye gelen geyiklerin çatal tırnaklarının izleri görülür.
es: Unas millas al sur de Soledad, el río Salinas se ahonda junto al margen de la ladera y fluye profundo y verde. Es tibia el agua, porque se ha deslizado chispeante sobre la arena amarilla y al calor del sol antes de llegar a la angosta laguna. A un lado del río, la dorada falda de la ladera se curva hacia arriba trepando hasta las montañas Gavilán, fuertes y rocosas, pero del lado del valle los árboles bordean la orilla: sauces frescos y verdes cada primavera, que en las junturas más bajas de sus hojas muestran las consecuencias de la crecida invernal; y sicomoros de troncos veteados, blancos, recostados, y ramas que se arquean sobre el estanque. En la arenosa orilla, bajo los árboles, yacen espesas las hojas, y tan quebradizas que las lagartijas hacen un ruido semejante al de un gran chisporroteo si corren entre ellas. Los conejos salen del matorral para sentarse en la arena al atardecer, y los terrenos bajos, siempre húmedos, están cubiertos por las huellas nocturnas de los coatíes, y por los manchones donde se han revolcado los perros de los ranchos, y por las marcas en forma de cuña partida dejadas por los ciervos que llegan para abrevar en la oscuridad.
vi_translation: About a few miles south of Soledad, the Salinas River drops in close to the hillside, its deep green water warmed by exposure to the golden sandy banks sparkling in the sunlight before it quietly flows into a narrow pool. On one bank, golden foothills rise, stretching all the way to the rocky Gabilan Mountains, while the other bank is lush with vegetation. In spring, the willows turn green, and the leaves at their bases still bear the marks of winter floods. The sycamore trees, with their smooth leaves and branches, extend out and form a canopy over the still water. On the sandy riverbank, fallen leaves create a thick, dry carpet that rustles loudly whenever a lizard scurries by. In the evening, rabbits emerge from the bushes to sit on the sand, and each morning the low ground often still bears the footprints or claw marks of fish-eating rats, ranch dogs, or deer that came to drink during the night.
tr_translation: South of Soledad, a few miles away, the Salinas River flows deep and green, skirting the hillside. The water is warm too, because before it becomes sluggish in this narrow bed, it has descended over yellow sands, sparkling in the sun. On one side of the creek, the golden slopes of the hill twist and turn all the way up to the rocky pile of the Gabilan Mountains, but towards the valley, the creek bank is wooded. In spring, willows, which take on a fresh green color, and sycamores, with mottled leaves and branches extending to form a dome over the still water, show traces of dust and soil left by the swollen winter waters in the middle of their lower leaves. On the sandy shore, leaves spread a thick carpet under the trees, so dry that the scurrying of a lizard creates a long rustle. In the evenings, rabbits come out of the brush to sit on the sands, and in the damp places, the tracks of raccoons that have roamed at night, big-footed farm dogs, and the cloven hooves of deer that come to drink in the dark can be seen.
es_translation: A few miles south of Soledad, the Salinas River deepens alongside the slope's edge and flows deep and green. The water is warm because it has sparkled over the yellow sand and under the sun's heat before reaching the narrow lagoon. On one side of the river, the golden slope curves upward, climbing to the Gabilan Mountains, strong and rocky, but on the valley side, trees line the shore: fresh and green willows every spring, which in the lower joints of their leaves show the consequences of the winter flood; and sycamores with streaked, white trunks, reclining, and branches that arch over the pond. On the sandy shore, under the trees, the leaves lie thick and so brittle that the lizards make a noise similar to a great crackling if they run among them. The rabbits come out of the brush to sit on the sand at dusk, and the lowlands, always damp, are covered with the nocturnal tracks of the raccoons, and with the patches where the ranch dogs have wallowed, and with the wedge-shaped marks left by the deer that come to drink in the darkness.

en: There is a path through the willows and among the sycamores, a path beaten hard by boys coming down from the ranches to swim in the deep pool, and beaten hard by tramps who come wearily down from the highway in the evening to jungle–up near water. In front of the low horizontal limb of a giant sycamore there is an ash pile made by many fires; the limb is worn smooth by men who have sat on it.
vi: Có một con đường mòn xuyên qua các rặng liễu và hàng sung, con đường này do lũ trẻ con ở trại vạch lối xuống tắm hay những kẻ lữ hành buổi chiều mệt nhọc từ đường cái quan xuống dừng chân tạm nghỉ ven sông. Phía trước một cành sung lớn, nằm là là ngang mặt đất và nhẵn thín vì đã có nhiều người ngồi, là một đống tro, dấu vết còn lại của nhiều lần khách nhóm lửa để sưởi.
tr: Söğütlerle frenk çınarlarının arasından bir patika geçer, derin sularda yıkanmak için civar çiftliklerden inen çocukların, akşamları yorgun düşerek şoseden ayrılıp dere kenarında konaklamaya gelen serserilerin taban teptikleri bir patika. Dev boylu bir frenk çınarının alçak ve yatay dalının önündeki bir kül yığını açıkta birçok ateşler yakılmış olduğuna delildir; dal da üzerine oturulmaktan yıpranmış ve adeta cilalanmıştır.
es: Hay un sendero a través de los sauces y entre los sicomoros; un sendero de tierra endurecida por el paso de los niños que vienen de los ranchos a nadar en la profunda laguna, y por el de los vagabundos que, por la noche, llegan cansados desde la carretera para acampar cerca del agua. Frente al bajo tronco horizontal de un sicomoro gigante se alza un montón de cenizas, resto de muchos fuegos; el tronco está pulido por los hombres que se han sentado en él.
vi_translation: There is a trail winding through the willow and fig trees, a path made by the children from the camp who go down to bathe or by weary travelers in the afternoon who descend from the main road to rest by the river. In front of a large fig branch, lying almost level with the ground and smooth from many people sitting on it, is a pile of ashes, the remnants of many times when travelers lit fires to warm themselves.
tr_translation: A path passes between the willows and the sycamores, a path trodden by children coming down from nearby farms to bathe in the deep waters, and by vagrants who, exhausted in the evenings, leave the highway to rest by the stream. A pile of ashes in front of a giant sycamore's low and horizontal branch is evidence that many fires have been lit there; the branch itself is worn and almost polished from being sat upon.
es_translation: There is a path through the willows and among the sycamores; a path of hardened earth from the passage of children coming from the ranches to swim in the deep lagoon, and from the vagabonds who, at night, arrive tired from the road to camp near the water. In front of the low horizontal trunk of a giant sycamore stands a pile of ashes, the remnants of many fires; the trunk is polished by the men who have sat on it.

en: The first man stopped short in the clearing, and the follower nearly ran over him. He took off his hat and wiped the sweat–band with his forefinger and snapped the moisture off. His huge companion dropped his blankets and flung himself down and drank from the surface of the green pool; drank with long gulps, snorting into the water like a horse. The small man stepped nervously beside him.
vi: Người đi trước bất thân dừng lại khiến bạn hắn xô phải suýt nhào trên mình hắn. Hắn bỏ mũ ra, lấy ngón tay trỏ quệt mồ hôi trên mũi rồi vẩy mạnh cho mồ hôi nhỏ xuống. Bạn hắn buông phịch bó mền ra, nhào sấp xuống mặt sông để uống. Hắn uống từng ngụm lớn, thở phì phì trong nước như ngựa. Người bé nhỏ bước lai gần gắt gỏng:
tr: Düzlüğe geldikleri zaman, öndeki adam ansızın durdu. Arkadaşı az kalsın onun üstüne yıkılıyordu. Şapkasını çıkardı, şehadet parmağıyla meşinini sıyırdı ve ter damlalarını silmek için parmağını şaklattı. Arkadaşı yükünü yere attı, yüzükoyun kapanarak, suyun yeşil yüzünden içmeye koyuldu. Bir beygir gibi ağzını şapırdatarak hızlı hızlı içiyordu. Kısa boylusu sinirli bir tavırla yanına yaklaştı:
es: El primer hombre se detuvo de pronto en el claro y el que le seguía casi tropezó con él. El más pequeño se quitó el sombrero y enjugó la badana con el índice y sacudió la humedad. Su enorme compañero dejó caer su frazada y se arrojó de bruces y bebió de la superficie de la verde laguna; bebió a largos tragos, resoplando en el agua como un caballo. El hombre pequeño se colocó nerviosamente a su lado.
vi_translation: The person walking in front suddenly stopped, causing his friend to almost stumble over him. He took off his hat, wiped the sweat off his nose with his index finger, and then flicked it off forcefully. His friend dropped the bundle of blankets with a thud and dove face-first into the river to drink. He drank in large gulps, snorting in the water like a horse. The small person stepped closer and snapped:
tr_translation: When they reached the plain, the man in front suddenly stopped. His friend almost stumbled over him. He took off his hat, wiped its leather with his index finger, and snapped his finger to wipe off the sweat drops. His friend threw his load to the ground, lay face down, and began to drink from the green surface of the water. He was drinking quickly, smacking his lips like a horse. The shorter one approached him with an irritated demeanor:
es_translation: The first man suddenly stopped in the clearing and the one following him almost stumbled into him. The smaller man took off his hat and wiped the sweatband with his finger, shaking off the moisture. His enormous companion dropped his blanket and threw himself face down, drinking from the surface of the green lagoon; he drank in long gulps, snorting in the water like a horse. The small man nervously positioned himself beside him.

en: “The hell with the rabbits. That’s all you ever can remember is them rabbits. O.K.! Now you listen and this time you got to remember so we don’t get in no trouble. You remember settin’ in that gutter on Howard street and watchin’ that blackboard?”
vi: - Câm mồm mày đi. Lúc nào cũng thỏ ! Nghe này ! Bây giờ mày nghe và cố nhớ để đừng gây rắc rối nữa. Mày có nhớ hôm hai đứa mình ngôi ở lề đường Heward Street, chăm chú nhìn cái bảng đen không?
tr: "Boş ver tavşanlara ulan. Zaten başka bir şey kalmaz aklında senin. Hadi! Dinle şimdi, bu sefer unutmamaya çalış ki, başımız belaya girmesin. Howard Street'de kaldırım kenarına oturmuş kara tahtaya bakıyordun, hatırladın mı?
es: —¡Al diablo con los conejos! Eso es todo lo que puedes recordar, los conejos. ¡Bueno! Ahora me escuchas y la próxima vez tienes que recordarlo, para que no nos veamos en apuros. ¿Recuerdas cuando nos sentamos en aquella alcantarilla de la calle Howard y miramos aquella pizarra?
vi_translation: - Shut your mouth. Always rabbiting on! Listen up! Now listen and try to remember so you don't cause any more trouble. Do you remember the day we both sat on the curb of Heward Street, intently looking at the blackboard?
tr_translation: "Forget about the rabbits, man. Nothing else sticks in your mind anyway. Come on! Listen now, this time try not to forget so we don't get into trouble. You were sitting on the edge of the sidewalk on Howard Street, looking at the blackboard, remember?"
es_translation: —To hell with the rabbits! That's all you can remember, the rabbits. Fine! Now listen to me and next time you have to remember it, so we don't get into trouble. Do you remember when we sat in that sewer on Howard Street and looked at that blackboard?

en: “That ranch we’re goin’ to is right down there about a quarter mile. We’re gonna go in an’ see the boss. Now, look—I’ll give him the work tickets, but you ain’t gonna say a word. You jus’ stand there and don’t say nothing. If he finds out what a crazy bastard you are, we won’t get no job, but if he sees ya work before he hears ya talk, we’re set. Ya got that?”
vi: - Cái trại tao với mày sắp tới ở ngay dưới này này, cách đây chừng một phần tư dặm. Mình vào đấy và phải gặp lão chủ. Bây giờ nghe đây. Tao đưa trình lão tấm các làm việc của chúng mình, nhưng mày nhớ là đừng nói gì cả. Mày đứng đó và câm mồm lại. Nếu lão mà biết mày ngu đần tới mực này thì lão sẽ không mướn đâu, nhưng nếu lão nhìn thấy mày làm việc rồi mới nghe mày nói thì mọi việc đều ổn cả. Mày hiểu không?
tr: "Bu gittiğimiz çiftlik nah şuracıkta, bir çeyrek mil ötede... Gidip patronu göreceğiz. Şimdi dinle beni... Ona iş kartlarımızı vereceğim, ama sen tek kelime söylemeyeceksin. Hiç ağzını açmayacaksın. Ne kadar salak olduğunu far kederse, almaz işe, ama konuşmanı duymadan önce, çalışmanı görürse, işler yolunda demektir. Anladın mı?
es: —El rancho adónde vamos está muy cerca. Iremos a ver al patrón. Ahora, fíjate. Yo le daré las tarjetas de empleo, pero tú no dirás ni una palabra. Te quedas quieto y no dices nada. Si descubre lo imbécil que eres, no nos va a dar trabajo, pero si te ve trabajar antes de oírte hablar, estamos contratados. ¿Lo has entendido?
vi_translation: - The camp you and I are heading to is right down here, about a quarter of a mile away. We'll go in there and have to meet the boss. Now listen here. I'll present the boss with our work cards, but remember, you don't say anything. You stand there and keep your mouth shut. If the boss knows you're this dumb, he won't hire you, but if he sees you work before he hears you talk, everything will be fine. Do you understand? - Understood!
tr_translation: "The farm we're going to is right over there, a quarter mile away... We're going to see the boss. Now listen to me... I'll give him our work cards, but you won't say a word. You won't open your mouth at all. If he realizes how dumb you are, he won't hire you, but if he sees you work before hearing you talk, things will be fine. Do you understand?"
es_translation: —The ranch we're going to is very close. We will go see the boss. Now, pay attention. I will give him the employment cards, but you won't say a word. You stay still and don't say anything. If he finds out how stupid you are, he won't give us work, but if he sees you work before he hears you speak, we're hired. Do you understand?

en: The day was going fast now. Only the tops of the Gabilan mountains flamed with the light of the sun that had gone from the valley. A water snake slipped along on the pool, its head held up like a little periscope. The reeds jerked slightly in the current. Far off toward the highway a man shouted something, and another man shouted back. The sycamore limbs rustled under a little wind that died immediately.
vi: Đêm bắt đầu xuống nhanh, chỉ ở trên đỉnh núi Gabilan còn sáng lấp loáng trong khi các tia nắng đã tắt ngấm trong lòng thung lũng. Một con rắn uốn mình dưới nước, đầu ngẩng lên như tấm kính tiềm vọng. Hàng lau khẽ động mình theo dòng nước . Phía xa, mé đường lộ có tiếng một người kêu rồi tiếng người đáp lại. Những cành sung rên rỉ duới làn gió nhẹ rồi lặng tắt.
tr: Artık ortalık hızla kararıyordu. Yalnız Galiban dağlarının doruğu, vadiden uzaklaşmış olan güneşin ışıklarıyla parıldıyordu. Bir yılan, başını periskop gibi çıkarmış, suda dalgalandı: Akıntıdan sazlar hafifçe kımıldıyordu. Uzakta, şosede, adamın biri, bir şeyler haykırdı, bir başkası ona cevap verdi. Frenk çınarlarının dallarını ürperten hafif bir yel esti ve hemen dindi.
es: El día moría rápidamente. Sólo las cimas de las montañas Gabilán llameaban con la luz del sol, que ya había desaparecido del valle. Una culebra de agua se deslizó por la laguna, alzada la cabeza como un periscopio diminuto. Las cañas se movían con pequeñas sacudidas en la corriente. Muy lejos, hacia la carretera, un hombre gritó algo y otro hombre gritó la respuesta. Las hojas de sicomoro susurraron con una ráfaga de viento que murió inmediatamente.
vi_translation: The night began to fall quickly, only the peak of Gabilan Mountain still glimmered while the rays of sunlight had completely faded in the valley. A snake slithered under the water, its head raised like a periscope. The reeds gently swayed with the flow of the water. In the distance, by the roadside, there was the sound of someone calling out and then a reply. The fig branches moaned under the light breeze and then fell silent.
tr_translation: It was quickly getting dark. Only the peak of the Galiban mountains was sparkling with the lights of the sun that had moved away from the valley. A snake, raising its head like a periscope, rippled in the water: The reeds were gently swaying from the current. In the distance, on the road, a man shouted something, and another replied to him. A light breeze that rustled the branches of the plane trees blew and then immediately died down.
es_translation: The day was dying quickly. Only the peaks of the Gabilán mountains blazed with the sunlight, which had already disappeared from the valley. A water snake slid across the lagoon, its head raised like a tiny periscope. The reeds moved with small jerks in the current. Far away, towards the road, a man shouted something and another man shouted back the response. The sycamore leaves whispered with a gust of wind that died immediately.

en: “Sure we are, if you gather up some dead willow sticks. I got three can of beans in my bindle. You get a fire ready. I’ll give you a match when you get the sticks together. Then we’ll heat the beans and have supper.”
vi: - Có chứ! Mày đi kiếm ngay ít củi. Tao có ba hộp đậu trong xắc rồi, kiếm củi xong tao đưa hộp quẹt cho mày nhóm lửa. Rồi chúng mình hâm đậu mà chén.
tr: "Yiyeceğiz elbet, git biraz kuru çalı-çırpı topla. Dengimde üç kutu fasulye var. Yak ateşi. Sen hazırla hele, bir kibrit veririm sana. Sonra fasulyeleri pişirir, yemeğimizi yeriz.
es: —Claro que sí, si recoges algunas ramas secas. Tengo tres latas de judías en mi hatillo. Prepara el fuego. Te daré una cerilla cuando juntes las ramas. Entonces calentaremos las judías y comeremos.
vi_translation: You go get some firewood right away. I already have three cans of beans in my bag, once you get the firewood, I'll give you the lighter to start the fire. Then we'll heat up the beans and eat.
tr_translation: "We will eat, of course, go gather some dry twigs and sticks. I have three cans of beans at my level. Light the fire. Prepare it first, and I'll give you a match. Then we'll cook the beans and eat our meal."
es_translation: —Of course, if you gather some dry branches. I have three cans of beans in my bundle. Prepare the fire. I'll give you a match when you gather the branches. Then we'll heat the beans and eat.

en: The red light dimmed on the coals. Up the hill from the river a coyote yammered, and a dog answered from the other side of the stream. The sycamore leaves whispered in a little night breeze.
vi: Ngọn lửa nhạt dần trên đám than hồng. Phía ngọn đồi bên mé sông, tiếng một con chó rừng sủa và bên này bờ sông có tiếng một con chó trại sủa đáp lại. Khóm lá sung xào xạc trong hơi gió đêm.
tr: Küllenen korların kırmızı parıltısı soluyordu. Suyun öbür yanındaki tepenin üstünde, bir koyot uludu, derenin öte yakasından bir köpek ona cevap verdi. Frenk çınarlarının yaprakları gecenin hafif soluğu altında hışırdadı.
es: La luz roja se extinguió en las brasas. Desde la colina al otro lado del río aulló un coyote y un perro respondió desde lejos. Las hojas de sicomoro susurraron con la apagada brisa de la noche.
vi_translation: The flame faded on the glowing embers. From the hill by the riverbank, the howl of a jackal could be heard, and from this side of the river, a farm dog barked in response. The cluster of fig leaves rustled in the night breeze.
tr_translation: The red glow of the smoldering embers was breathing. On top of the hill on the other side of the water, a coyote howled, and a dog answered it from across the creek. The leaves of the sycamore trees rustled under the gentle breath of the night.
es_translation: The red light extinguished in the embers. From the hill on the other side of the river, a coyote howled and a dog responded from afar. The sycamore leaves whispered with the muted night breeze.

en: “The boss was expectin’ you last night,” the old man said. “He was sore as hell when you wasn’t here to go out this morning.” He pointed with his right arm, and out of the sleeve came a round stick–like wrist, but no hand. “You can have them two beds there,” he said, indicating two bunks near the stove.
vi: Lão già nói: - Ông chủ chờ các anh từ chiều hôm qua! Sáng nay vẫn chưa thấy các anh tới, ông ấy đã nổi sung rồi đó. Lão nhấc tay phải lên, cái cổ tay cụt, tròn như một mẫu gỗ lòi ra từ trong ống tay áo, chỉ hai cái giường gần bếp: - Giường của hai bác đây này.
tr: İhtiyar: "Patron sizi dün akşam bekliyordu," dedi. "Bu sabah hâlâ gelmediğinizi görünce, fena halde küplere bindi." Sağ kolunu uzattı, yeninden ensiz, odun parçası gibi yusyuvarlak bir bilek çıktı: Sobanın yanındaki iki yatağı göstererek: "Şu iki yatakta yatabilirsiniz," dedi.
es: —El patrón os esperaba anoche —dijo el viejo—. Se enojó como el diablo cuando no os vio esta mañana para ir a trabajar. Señaló con el brazo derecho, y de la manga surgió una muñeca redonda como un palo, pero sin mano. —Podéis ocupar aquellas dos camas —agregó, indicando dos camastros cerca de la estufa.
vi_translation: The old man said: - The boss has been waiting for you since yesterday afternoon! This morning, he still hasn't seen you, and he's already furious. The old man raised his right hand, the wrist stump, round like a piece of wood protruding from the sleeve, pointing to the two beds near the stove: - Here is your bed.
tr_translation: The old man said: "The boss was expecting you last night," he said. "When he saw that you still hadn't come this morning, he got really angry." He extended his right arm, from his sleeve emerged a narrow, round wrist like a piece of wood: Pointing to the two beds next to the stove: "You can sleep in these two beds," he said.
es_translation: —The boss was expecting you last night —said the old man—. He got mad as the devil when he didn't see you this morning to go to work. He pointed with his right arm, and from the sleeve emerged a round wrist like a stick, but without a hand. —You can take those two beds —he added, pointing to two cots near the stove.

en: “Says ‘positively kills lice, roaches and other scourges.’ What the hell kind of bed you giving us, anyways. We don’t want no pants rabbits.”
vi: - Nghe này “diệt trừ chấy rận, gián và các giống bọ khác”. Thế này mà cụ gọi là giường ngủ đây à? Nằm đây thì rận gián nó cắn chết mất.
tr: "Bit, karafatma ve her türlü böcekleri toptan yok eder, yazılı burada. Ne biçim yataklar veriyorsunuz bize? Ufaklık toplamaya niyetimiz yok.
es: —Aquí dice «mata positivamente piojos, cucarachas y otros insectos». Vaya condenada clase de camas que nos dan, ¿verdad? No queremos bichitos de éstos.
vi_translation: - Listen to this: “exterminate lice, cockroaches, and other kinds of bugs.” Is this what you call a bed? Lying here, the lice and cockroaches will bite you to death.
tr_translation: "It says here that it exterminates bedbugs, cockroaches, and all kinds of insects wholesale. What kind of beds are you giving us? We have no intention of collecting little ones."
es_translation: —Here it says "positively kills lice, cockroaches, and other insects." What a damned kind of beds they give us, right? We don't want these little bugs.

en: “Yeah. Nice fella too. Got a crooked back where a horse kicked him. The boss gives him hell when he’s mad. But the stable buck don’t give a damn about that. He reads a lot. Got books in his room.”
vi: - Ừ, nhọ. Nó khá lắm. Nó bị ngựa đá vẹo lưng. Khi ông chủ bực bội, ông chửi nó hoài. Nhưng mà nó cóc cần. Nó đọc sách cả ngày. Nó có khối sách trong buồng kia.
tr: "Ya. İyi adamdır doğrusu. Sırtı kamburdur. Vaktiyle at tepmiş. Patron ne zaman başı kızsa, ona çıkışır. Ama boş verir seyis. Her zaman okur. Odasında kitaplar vardır.
es: —Sí. Un buen tipo. Tiene la espalda torcida porque un caballo lo coceó. El patrón se las hace pasar buenas cuando se enoja. Pero al peón del establo no le importa nada. Lee mucho. Tiene libros en su habitación.
vi_translation: - Yeah, it's unlucky. He's quite something. He got kicked by a horse and his back got twisted. When the boss gets angry, he scolds him constantly. But he doesn't care at all. He reads books all day. He has a ton of books in that room.
tr_translation: "Yes. He is indeed a good man. His back is humped. A horse kicked him once. Whenever the boss gets angry, he scolds him. But the groom doesn't care. He always reads. He has books in his room."
es_translation: —Yes. A good guy. His back is twisted because a horse kicked him. The boss gives him a hard time when he gets angry. But the stable hand doesn't care about anything. He reads a lot. He has books in his room.

en: The old swamper looked quickly at him, and then shuffled to the door rubbing his whiskers with his knuckles as he went, “Them guys just come,” he said, and shuffled past the boss and out the door.
vi: Lão già vội liếc mắt nhìn chủ, bước lê về cửa, tay gãi râu và nói: - Dạ thưa họ vừa tới xong. Lão bước qua mặt ông chủ rồi ra ngoài.
tr: İhtiyar adam ona bir göz attı, yumruğuyla sakalını sıvazlayıp ayaklarım sürüyerek kapıya doğruldu. "Şimdi geldiler," dedi. Patronun yanından geçip dışarı çıktı.
es: El viejo de la escoba lo miró rápidamente luego se dirigió, arrastrando los pies, hacia la puerta, mientras con los nudillos se frotaba las patillas. —Acaban de llegar estos dos —afirmó, y arrastrando los pies pasó junto al patrón y salió por la puerta.
vi_translation: The old man quickly glanced at the owner, shuffled towards the door, scratching his beard, and said: - Yes, they just arrived. The old man walked past the boss and went outside.
tr_translation: The old man glanced at him, stroked his beard with his fist, and shuffled towards the door. "They have arrived now," he said. He passed by the boss and went outside.
es_translation: The old man with the broom looked at him quickly, then shuffled towards the door while rubbing his sideburns with his knuckles. —These two have just arrived —he stated, and dragging his feet, he walked past the boss and went out the door.

en: The names were entered in the book. “Le’s see, this is the twentieth, noon the twentieth.” He closed the book. “Where you boys been working?”
vi: Người chủ ghi tên vào sổ: - Xem nào, hôm nay là hai mươi, trưa hai mươi. Lão gấp sổ lại: - Cả hai anh trước làm ở đâu?
tr: İsimler deftere yazıldı. "Bugün neydi, ha ayın yirmisi, öğle zamanı. Defteri kapadı. "Nerede çalıştınız ikiniz?
es: Los nombres quedaron inscritos en la libreta. —Vamos a ver; hoy es veinte, el veinte a mediodía... —dijo cerrando la libreta—. ¿Dónde habéis estado trabajando últimamente?
vi_translation: The owner writes the name in the book: - Let's see, today is the twentieth, noon on the twentieth. The old man closed the notebook: - Where did both of you work before?
tr_translation: The names were written in the notebook. "What was today, oh the twentieth of the month, around noon."" He closed the notebook. "Where did you both work?""
es_translation: The names were inscribed in the notebook. —Let's see; today is the twentieth, the twentieth at noon... —he said, closing the notebook—. Where have you been working lately?

en: The boss deliberately put the little book in his pocket. He hooked his thumbs in his belt and squinted one eye nearly closed. “Say—what you sellin’?”
vi: Người chủ đã có chủ ý, nhét sổ vào túi. Lão thọc ngón tay cái vào thắt lưng, nheo mắt mắt lại và hỏi. - Này George. Anh định mưu tính gì đây?
tr: Patron defteri cebine koydu. Baş parmaklarını kemerine geçirdi ve bir gözünü kırptı: "Bana baksana sen," dedi.
es: El patrón metió lentamente la libreta en el bolsillo. Enganchó los pulgares en el cinturón y guiñó un ojo hasta cerrarlo casi. —Oye... ¿Qué papel juegas tú en esto?
vi_translation: The owner had a plan, slipping the notebook into his pocket. He stuck his thumb into his belt, squinted his eyes, and asked. - Hey George. What are you planning?
tr_translation: The boss put the notebook in his pocket. He hooked his thumbs into his belt and winked: "Hey, look at me," he said.
es_translation: The boss slowly put the notebook in his pocket. He hooked his thumbs into his belt and winked one eye almost shut. —Hey... What role do you play in this?

en: “Yeah. Big tall skinner. You’ll see him at dinner.” He turned abruptly and went to the door, but before he went out he turned and looked for a long moment at the two men.
vi: - Ừ, Slim là gã cao lớn đánh xe. Trưa ăn cơm anh sẽ gặp nó. Người chủ quay phắt về phía cửa, nhưng trước khi ra còn quay lại nhìn chằm chặp hai người một hồi lâu.
tr: "Evet. İri yarı bir arabacı. Yemekte görürsün. Birden döndü, kapıya doğru yürüdü, fakat dışarı çıkmadan önce geri döndü, iki adamı uzun uzun süzdü.
es: —Sí. Un mulero, alto, grande. Ya lo veréis en la comida. Se volvió de repente y se dirigió hacia la puerta, pero antes de salir se dio la vuelta otra vez y miró durante un rato a los dos hombres.
vi_translation: - Yes, Slim is the tall guy who drives the wagon. You will meet him at lunch. The owner quickly turned towards the door, but before leaving, he turned back and stared at the two people for a long time.
tr_translation: "Yes. A big burly coachman. You will see him at dinner." Suddenly, he turned, walked towards the door, but before going out, he turned back and scrutinized the two men for a long time.
es_translation: —Yes. A mule driver, tall, big. You will see him at the meal. He suddenly turned around and headed towards the door, but before leaving, he turned around again and looked at the two men for a while.

en: “Yeah. I had ’im ever since he was a pup. God, he was a good sheep dog when he was younger.” He stood his broom against the wall and he rubbed his white bristled cheek with his knuckles. “How’d you like the boss?” he asked.
vi: - Ừ, tôi nuôi nó từ hồi nó còn bé xíu. Trời ? Lúc nó nhỏ, nó hay lắm kia. Lão đặt cái chổi dựa vào tường và lấy tay gãi chòm râu xám. - Bác thấy ông chủ thế nào?
tr: "Öyle, küçükten büyüttüm onu. Eh eskiden mükemmel bir çoban köpeğiydi o." Süpürgesini duvara dayadı, kırçıl sakalını yumruğuyla sıvazladı: "Nasıl bizim patron, ha?"
es: —Sí. Lo tengo desde que era cachorro. Cielos, era un buen ovejero cuando era joven. Apoyó la escoba contra la pared y se frotó con los nudillos la mejilla erizada de canas. —¿Qué te pareció el patrón? —preguntó.
vi_translation: - Yes, I have raised it since it was very little. Really? When it was small, it was very clever. The old man placed the broom against the wall and scratched his gray beard with his hand. - How do you find the boss?
tr_translation: "Yes, I raised him from a pup." "Well, he used to be an excellent shepherd dog." He leaned his broom against the wall and stroked his grizzled beard with his fist: "How is our boss, huh?"
es_translation: —Yes. I've had him since he was a puppy. Heavens, he was a good shepherd when he was young. He leaned the broom against the wall and rubbed his stubbly cheek with his knuckles. —What did you think of the boss? —he asked.

en: The swamper considered…. “Well … tell you what. Curley’s like a lot of little guys. He hates big guys. He’s alla time picking scraps with big guys. Kind of like he’s mad at ’em because he ain’t a big guy. You seen little guys like that, ain’t you? Always scrappy?”
vi: Lão già nghĩ ngợi... - Hừ… Tôi nói cho mà hay. Curley cũng giống như mấy thằng nhóc khác. Thấy ai cao lớn nó không ưa. Thấy người nào to con thì nó kiếm chuyện suốt ngày. Cứ như là nó nổi xung thấy mình không được to con như vậy. Chắc bác biết rõ tụi nhóc như vậy chứ. Suốt ngày chỉ gây lộn.
tr: Durup dururken Lennie'ye çatmakta ne anlam var? "Bak ne diyeceğim. Curley bütün ufak tefek insanlar gibidir. İri yarı adamlardan hoşlanmaz. Hep böyleleriyle çatışır durur. Kendisi daha küçük yapılı olduğu için, içerler adeta. Böylelerine hiç rastlamadın mı? Durmadan maraza çıkarırlar.
es: El barrendero reflexionó un momento. —Bueno..., te diré. Curley es como muchos otros hombres pequeños. Odia a los grandullones. No hace más que buscar las cosquillas a los grandullones. Como si se enojara con ellos porque él no es grande. Habrás conocido tipos así, ¿verdad? Siempre buscando pendencia.
vi_translation: The old man pondered... - Hmph... Let me tell you something. Curley is just like the other kids. He doesn't like anyone who's tall. He picks fights with anyone who's big all day long. It's like he gets mad because he's not as big. You must know kids like that, right? Always causing trouble all day long.
tr_translation: What's the point of picking on Lennie for no reason?" "Guess what I'm going to say. Curley is like all small people. He doesn't like big guys. He's always picking fights with them. Because he's smaller in build, he resents them. Haven't you ever come across people like that? They're always causing trouble."
es_translation: The street sweeper reflected for a moment. —Well..., I'll tell you. Curley is like many other small men. He hates big guys. He does nothing but pick on the big guys. As if he gets mad at them because he isn't big. You must have known guys like that, right? Always looking for a fight.

en: The old man moved toward the door, and his ancient dog lifted his head and peered about, and then got painfully to his feet to follow. “I gotta be settin’ out the wash basins for the guys. The teams’ll be in before long. You guys gonna buck barley?”
vi: Lão già bước ra phía cửa và con chó ngửng đầu lên nhìn chung quanh. Rồi nó nặng nhọc đứng dậy bước theo. Lão già nói: Tôi phải đem chậu ra sẵn cho mọi người. Xe sắp về tới tôi. Hai bác được xếp vào toán khiêng thóc phải không?
tr: İhtiyar, kapıya doğru yürüdü, yaşlı köpeği başını kaldırıp çevresine bakındı. Sonra peşinden gitmek için güçlükle yerinden doğruldu. "Arabalar nerdeyse gelirler. Gidip yıkanma kovalarını çıkarayım. Siz de arpa mı yükleyeceksiniz?
es: El anciano se movió hacia la puerta; su pobre perro levantó la cabeza y espió a su alrededor, y por fin se puso dolorosamente de pie para seguir al amo. —Tengo que poner las palanganas para que se laven los muchachos. Las cuadrillas volverán dentro de poco. ¿Vais a cargar cebada?
vi_translation: The old man stepped towards the door and the dog lifted its head to look around. Then it heavily got up and followed. The old man said: I have to bring the basin out ready for everyone. The vehicle is about to arrive. Were you two assigned to the rice-carrying team?
tr_translation: The old man walked towards the door, his old dog lifted its head and looked around. Then it struggled to get up and follow him. "The cars are almost here. I'll go and get the washing buckets out. Are you going to load barley too?"
es_translation: The old man moved towards the door; his poor dog lifted its head and peered around, and finally painfully got up to follow its master. —I have to set out the basins so the boys can wash up. The crews will be back shortly. Are you going to load barley?

en: “Oh!” She put her hands behind her back and leaned against the door frame so that her body was thrown forward. “You’re the new fellas that just come, ain’t ya?”
vi: - Thế à Ả chắp tay sau lưng và dựa mình vào khung cửa sổ, cố ý làm nổi bật thân hình lên. - Các anh mới tới phải không?
tr: "Ya!" Kadın, göğsünü daha fazla çıkarmak için elini arkasına götürerek, kapı pervazına dayandı. "Yeni gelenler siz misiniz?
es: —¡Oh! Puso las manos detrás de la espalda y se apoyó contra el marco de la puerta de modo que las formas de su cuerpo se insinuaron a través de la ropa. —¿Sois esos dos peones nuevos que acaban de llegar, eh?
vi_translation: - Really? She clasped her hands behind her back and leaned against the window frame, intentionally highlighting her figure. - You guys just arrived, right?
tr_translation: "Hey!" The woman leaned against the door frame, taking her hand to her back to push her chest out further. "Are you the newcomers?"
es_translation: —Oh! He put his hands behind his back and leaned against the door frame in such a way that the shapes of his body were hinted at through his clothes. —Are you those two new laborers who just arrived, huh?

en: “Listen to me, you crazy bastard,” he said fiercely. “Don’t you even take a look at that bitch. I don’t care what she says and what she does. I seen ’em poison before, but I never seen no piece of jail bait worse than her. You leave her be.”
vi: Nó nói giận dữ: - Đồ điếm chó. Đừng có nhìn vào con đĩ ngựa ấy. Tao đếch thèm biết nó nói gì hay làm gì. Thứ rắn độc này, tao thấy đã nhiều nhưng chưa bao giờ tao được thấy thứ dữ như vậy. Đừng rờ vào nó nhé.
tr: Kızarak: "Bana bak, andavallı, bu orospuya bakmak yok. Bana ne, ne derse desin, ne yaparsa yapsın, vız gelir. Böyle yılanları çok gördüm ben, adamı kodese tıktırmak için birebirdirler. Dokunma o karıya.
es: —Oye lo que te digo, imbécil —le espetó con fuerza—. No vayas a mirar siquiera a esa perra. No me importa lo que diga o lo que haga ella. Las he conocido peligrosas, pero jamás he visto veneno como ésta. Es un cebo para la cárcel. Déjala tranquila.
vi_translation: He said angrily: - You filthy whore. Don't look at that slut. I don't give a damn what she says or does. I've seen many venomous snakes, but I've never seen one as vicious as her. Don't touch her.
tr_translation: Blushing: "Listen to me, idiot, you are not to look at that whore. I don't care, whatever she says, whatever she does, it doesn't matter to me. I've seen many snakes like her, they're perfect for getting a man thrown in jail. Don't touch that woman."
es_translation: —Listen to what I'm telling you, idiot —he snapped forcefully—. Don't even think about looking at that bitch. I don't care what she says or what she does. I've known dangerous ones, but I've never seen poison like this one. She's bait for jail. Leave her alone.

en: “No, you never. But when she was standin’ in the doorway showin’ her legs, you wasn’t lookin’ the other way, neither.”
vi: - Đúng, mày không làm gì cả, nhưng lúc con bé đứng kia kìa, phơi đùi ra, thì mày cứ nhìn chòng chọc vào nó.
tr: "Bir şey yapmadım, George. "Yapmadın elbet, ama demin orada kapı aralığında karı baldırlarını gösterirken gözlerini ayırmıyordun maldan.
es: —No, nada. Pero cuando estaba ahí en la puerta enseñando las piernas, tú no mirabas para otro lado, ¿eh?
vi_translation: - Yes, you didn't do anything, but when the girl was standing over there, showing off her thighs, you kept staring at her.
tr_translation: "I didn't do anything, George."" "Of course you didn't, but just now, while the woman was showing her calves in the doorway, you couldn't take your eyes off the goods."
es_translation: —No, nothing. But when she was there at the door showing her legs, you weren't looking the other way, were you?

en: He smoothed out his crushed hat, creased it in the middle and put it on. He looked kindly at the two in the bunk house. “It’s brighter’n a bitch outside,” he said gently. “Can’t hardly see nothing in here. You the new guys?”
vi: Hắn sửa chiếc mũ nhăn nheo, làm một đường rẽ phía giữa và đội lên đầu. Hắn nhìn hai người trong phòng một cách nhân hậu. Hắn nói, giọng ưu ái: - Phía ngoài nắng như đốt. Vào đây hoa mắt chả thấy gì hết. Các bác vừa mới đến à
tr: Ezilmiş şapkasını düzeltti, ortadan yarıp başına geçirdi. Odadaki iki adama iyicil bir bakışla baktı. Nezaketle: "Dışarda öyle kızgın bir güneş var ki, gözlerim kamaştı..." dedi. "İçeriyi göremiyorum. Yeni gelenler siz misiniz?
es: Ajustó el aplastado sombrero, le hizo un surco en el medio y se lo puso. Miró bondadosamente a los dos hombres que había en el cuarto. —Hay más luz que el diablo ahí fuera —dijo suavemente—. Apenas puedo ver ahora. ¿Vosotros sois los nuevos?
vi_translation: He adjusted the crumpled hat, made a part in the middle, and put it on his head. He looked at the two people in the room benevolently. He spoke, in a kind voice: - Outside, the sun is scorching. Coming in here, I can't see anything at all. Have you just arrived?
tr_translation: He straightened his crushed hat and placed it on his head, parting it down the middle. He looked at the two men there with a benevolent gaze. Politely: "The sun outside is so blazing that my eyes are dazzled..." he said. "I can't see inside. Are you the newcomers?"
es_translation: He adjusted the crushed hat, made a crease in the middle, and put it on. He looked kindly at the two men who were in the room. —There is more light than the devil out there —he said softly—. I can barely see now. Are you the new ones?

en: They went out the door. The sunshine lay in a thin line under the window. From a distance there could be heard a rattle of dishes.
vi: Chúng bước ra ngoài. Mặt trời chỉ còn là một vạch mỏng dưới cửa sổ. Xa xa, người ta có thể nghe tiếng chén bát va chạm nhau.
tr: Çıktılar. Güneş artık pencerenin altında ince bir çizgiden ibaret kalmıştı. Uzakta, bir tabak, çanak gürültüsü duyuluyordu.
es: Salieron del edificio. El sol trazaba una fina línea bajo la ventana. De la distancia llegaba un ruido de platos.
vi_translation: They stepped outside. The sun was just a thin line below the window. In the distance, one could hear the clinking of dishes.
tr_translation: They went out. The sun was now just a thin line below the window. In the distance, the clatter of dishes could be heard.
es_translation: They left the building. The sun drew a thin line under the window. From the distance came the sound of dishes.

en: Although there was evening brightness showing through the windows of the bunk house, inside it was dusk. Through the open door came the thuds and occasional clangs of a horseshoe game, and now and then the sound of voices raised in approval or derision.
vi: Mặc dầu trời còn sáng ngoài cửa sổ, bên trong nhà trại lại tối sầm. Từ phía cửa vọng lại tiếng ồn ào và đôi lúc tiếng móng ngựa chạm vào nhau kêu chát chúa. Thỉnh thoảng tiếng hoan hô hay chỉ trích lại nổi lên.
tr: Pencerelerde akşamın aydınlığı parıldamakla birlikte, barakanın içi karanlıktı. Açık kapıdan bir nal oyununun boğuk gürültüsü ve zaman zaman demirlerin çınlaması duyuluyordu. Arasıra beğeni ya da itiraz sesleri yükseliyordu.
es: Aunque se veía el resplandor del atardecer por las ventanas del barracón de peones, dentro estaba oscuro. Por la puerta abierta llegaban los golpes sordos y los ocasionales tañidos de un juego de herraduras, y de vez en cuando el sonido de voces elevadas para aprobar o mofarse, según la jugada.
vi_translation: Although it was still bright outside the window, inside the house it was dark. From the direction of the door came the sound of noise and occasionally the clanging of horses' hooves. From time to time, cheers or criticisms would arise.
tr_translation: Although the evening light was shimmering in the windows, the inside of the barrack was dark. From the open door, the muffled noise of a horseshoe game and the occasional clanging of iron could be heard. From time to time, sounds of approval or objection would rise.
es_translation: Although the glow of the sunset could be seen through the windows of the workers' barrack, it was dark inside. Through the open door came the dull thuds and occasional chimes of a game of horseshoes, and from time to time the sound of raised voices to approve or mock, depending on the play.

en: “Hell, no. He just scared her. I’d be scared too if he grabbed me. But he never hurt her. He jus’ wanted to touch that red dress, like he wants to pet them pups all the time.”
vi: - Hẳn là chưa rồi.. Nó chỉ làm con nhỏ sợ, thế thôi. Tôi mà bị vào tay nó, tôi cũng hết hồn. Nhưng mà nó không động gì tới con nhỏ hết. Nó chỉ muốn mân mê cái áo đỏ giống hệt như bây giờ nó muốn vuốt ve hoài lũ chó con kia kìa.
tr: "Yok be canım. Sadece ödünü patlattı, işte o kadar. Bana el sürse bile korkardım. Ama kıza bir şey yapmadı. Sadece al fistanını okşamak istiyordu, tıpkı durmadan inekleri okşadığı gibi.
es: —No, qué diablos. La asustó, nada más. Yo también me asustaría si me agarrara. Pero no le hizo daño. Sólo quería tocarle el vestido, del mismo modo que le gusta acariciar a esos cachorros.
vi_translation: - Surely not yet.. It just scared the little girl, that's all. If I were in its hands, I would be terrified too. But it didn't do anything to the little girl at all. It just wanted to caress the red shirt just like it now wants to keep petting those puppies over there.
tr_translation: "No way, dear. He just scared her, that's all. I would be afraid even if he touched me. But he didn't do anything to the girl. He just wanted to caress her dress, just like he constantly caresses the cows."
es_translation: —No, what the hell. He just scared her, nothing more. I would be scared too if he grabbed me. But he didn't hurt her. He just wanted to touch her dress, in the same way he likes to pet those puppies.

en: The young man turned to the back of the magazine, put it down on the table and pointed with his finger. “Right there, read that.” Slim bent over it. “Go on,” said the young man. “Read it out loud.”
vi: Gã trẻ tuổi lật trên trang ở phần cuối tạp chí rồi đặt lên bàn và lấy ngón tay chỉ: - Đây này, đọc đi. Slim cúi xuống. Gã trẻ tuổi tiếp: - Đọc lớn lên cùng nghe nào.
tr: Genç adam derginin son sayfasını karıştırdı, dergiyi masanın üstüne koyarak, eliyle işaret etti: "Şunu oku bak. Slim eğildi. "Hadi, yüksek sesle oku," dedi adam.
es: El mozo abrió la revista por una de las últimas páginas, la puso sobre la mesa y señaló con el dedo. —Aquí, lee esto. Slim se inclinó sobre la mesa. —Vamos —dijo el mozo—. Léelo en voz alta.
vi_translation: The young man flipped to the page at the end of the magazine, placed it on the table, and pointed with his finger: - Here, read this. Slim bent down. The young man continued: - Read it out loud so we can all hear.
tr_translation: The young man flipped through the last page of the magazine, placed the magazine on the table, and pointed with his hand: "Read this, look." Slim leaned over. "Come on, read aloud," said the man.
es_translation: The waiter opened the magazine to one of the last pages, placed it on the table, and pointed with his finger. —Here, read this. Slim leaned over the table. —Let's go —said the young man—. Read it out loud.

en: Whit broke out, “What the hell’s takin’ him so long? Lay out some cards, why don’t you? We ain’t going to get no euchre played this way.”
vi: Whit nổ bùng : - Trời ơi! Sao lâu dữ vậy. Mà sao anh không chia bài đi? Bảo đánh bài mà sao kỳ vậy?
tr: Whil dayanamadı: "Ulan amma uzattın be? Neden vermiyorsun kağıtları? Böyle mi oynayacağız?
es: —¿Por qué diablos tardas tanto? —estalló Whit—. Empieza a dar cartas, ¿quieres? Así no vamos a jugar nunca.
vi_translation: Whit exploded : - Oh my God! Why is it taking so long? Why aren't you dealing the cards? You said we were going to play cards, so what's going on?
tr_translation: He couldn't stand it any longer: "Man, you're dragging this out too much, aren't you?" Why aren't you giving the cards? Is this how we're going to play?"
es_translation: —Why the hell are you taking so long? —Whit burst out—. Start dealing cards, will you? This way, we'll never get to play.

en: Whit laughed again. “You do if you been around these big ranches much. Guy that wants to look over a ranch comes in Sat’day afternoon. He gets Sat’day night supper an’ three meals on Sunday, and he can quit Monday mornin’ after breakfast without turning his hand. But you come to work Friday noon. You got to put in a day an’ a half no matter how you figure.”
vi: - Tôi vẫn không hiểu tính thế là thế nào? Whit cười rộ : - Anh mà làm mướn lâu năm trong các nông trại lớn thì biết liền. Thằng cha nào muốn tới xem cho biết nước biết cái ở một trại nào thường tới chiều thứ bảy, ba bữa ngày chủ nhật và sáng thứ hai ăn lót lòng xong, nó có thể cuốn gói đi mà đếch phải làm gì cả. Còn các anh, các anh lại tới nhận việc trưa thứ sáu. Như vậy các anh phải làm việc một ngày rưỡi, dù anh muốn tính sao mặc lòng.
tr: George: "Bu hesaba aklım ermedi," dedi. "Bu büyük çiftliklerde, uzun zaman kalmış olsaydın anlardın. Bir çiftliği şöyle bir kolaçan etmek isteyen adam, cumartesi öğleden sonra gelir. O gün akşam yemeğini, pazar günü de üç öğün yemek yer, pazartesi de kahvaltıdan sonra elini bile kımıldatmadan çeker arabasını gider. Halbuki siz, cuma günü öğleyin geldiniz çalışmaya. Demek ki hesabınız ne olursa olsun, en az bir buçuk gün çalışmak zorundasınız.
es: Otra vez rió Whit. —Ya lo entenderás cuando hayas trabajado un tiempo en estos ranchos grandes. El hombre que quiere ver cómo es el lugar llega el sábado por la tarde. Le dan de comer el sábado por la noche y tres veces el domingo, y puede irse el lunes por la mañana, después del desayuno, sin haber trabajado ni un minuto. Pero vinisteis el viernes al mediodía. Lo hagáis como lo hagáis, tenéis que trabajar un día y medio.
vi_translation: - I still don't understand what that means? Whit laughed heartily: - If you have worked for many years on large farms, you would know immediately. Anyone who wants to come and see what it's like at a farm usually arrives on Saturday evening, spends Sunday, and after breakfast on Monday morning, they can pack up and leave without having to do anything at all. But you guys, you come to take the job on Friday noon. So you have to work for a day and a half, no matter how you want to calculate it.
tr_translation: George: "I couldn't make sense of this account," he said. "If you had stayed on these large farms for a long time, you would understand. A man who wants to take a quick look around a farm comes on Saturday afternoon. He has dinner that evening, eats three meals on Sunday, and on Monday, after breakfast, he leaves without lifting a finger. However, you came to work on Friday at noon. So, no matter what your plan is, you have to work for at least a day and a half."
es_translation: Whit laughed again. —You will understand it when you have worked for a while on these big ranches. The man who wants to see what the place is like arrives on Saturday afternoon. They feed him on Saturday night and three times on Sunday, and he can leave on Monday morning, after breakfast, without having worked a minute. But you came on Friday at noon. No matter how you do it, you have to work a day and a half.

en: “Sure, we’d have a little house an’ a room to ourself. Little fat iron stove, an’ in the winter we’d keep a fire goin’ in it. It ain’t enough land so we’d have to work too hard. Maybe six, seven hours a day. We wouldn’t have to buck no barley eleven hours a day. An’ when we put in a crop, why, we’d be there to take the crop up. We’d know what come of our planting.”
vi: - Ừ, mình sẽ có một căn nhà nhỏ và một phòng riêng. Một cái lò sưởi tròn bàng gang để đốt lửa vào mùa đông. Vườn thì không rộng lắm, như thế đỡ làm việc vất vả. Chừng sáu hay bảy giờ mỗi ngày. Khỏi phải gánh lúa mạch mỗi ngày mười một tiếng đồng hồ. Hễ có lúa mà gặt thì gặt cho mình. Mình làm thì mình hưởng.
tr: "Böyle işte, küçük bir evimiz, her birimiz için ayrı bir odamız olacak. Yusyuvarlak bir de küçük dökme sobamız; kışın onu yakacağız. Toprağımız çok olmayacağından, öyle fazla yorulmak zorunda kalmayacağız. Günde belki altı, yedi saat. Günde on bir saat arpa yüklemeyeceğiz. Bir şeyler ektiğimiz zaman ürünü de kendimiz toplayacağız. Ektiğimizin ne sonuç verdiğini gözümüzle göreceğiz.
es: —Claro, vamos a tener una casita, con una habitación para nosotros. Una buena estufa de hierro y en invierno mantendremos el fuego siempre encendido. No es demasiada tierra, de modo que no tendremos que trabajar mucho. Quizás seis o siete horas por día. Pero se acabó lo de cargar sacos de cebada durante once horas cada día. Y cuando llegue la cosecha, allí estaremos nosotros para recogerla. Así sabremos qué resulta de lo que sembramos.
vi_translation: - Yes, we will have a small house and a private room. A round cast iron stove to light a fire in the winter. The garden won't be very large, so we won't have to work too hard. About six or seven hours each day. No more carrying barley for eleven hours a day. If there's grain to harvest, we'll harvest it for ourselves. We work, we enjoy the fruits of our labor.
tr_translation: "That's it, we will have a small house, and each of us will have our own room. We will also have a small round cast iron stove; we will light it in winter. Since we won't have much land, we won't have to work too hard. Maybe six or seven hours a day. We won't be loading barley for eleven hours a day. When we plant something, we will also harvest it ourselves. We will see with our own eyes what our planting yields."
es_translation: —Of course, we are going to have a little house, with a room for us. A good iron stove and in winter we will keep the fire always burning. It's not too much land, so we won't have to work a lot. Maybe six or seven hours a day. But no more carrying barley sacks for eleven hours every day. And when the harvest comes, we will be there to gather it. That way we will know what comes from what we sow.

en: “Sure, you’d go out in the alfalfa patch an’ you’d have a sack. You’d fill up the sack and bring it in an’ put it in the rabbit cages.”
vi: - Này nhé, mày ra đồng cỏ linh lăng với cái bao. Mày hái đầy bao rồi đem về cho thỏ trong chuồng.
tr: "Bir çuval alıp yonca tarlasına gideceksin. Çuvalı doldurup, tavşan kümesine gireceksin.
es: —Claro, vas a ir al campo de alfalfa con un saco. Vas a llenar el saco y a poner la alfalfa en las conejeras.
vi_translation: - Now, you go to the alfalfa field with the bag. Fill the bag and bring it back for the rabbits in the cage.
tr_translation: "You will take a sack and go to the clover field. You will fill the sack and enter the rabbit hutch."
es_translation: —Of course, you are going to the alfalfa field with a sack. You are going to fill the sack and put the alfalfa in the rabbit hutches.

en: “Well, I got a right to have a light. You go on get outta my room. I ain’t wanted in the bunk house, and you ain’t wanted in my room.”
vi: - Hừ, tôi có quyền thắp đèn chớ. Thôi bước ra đi. Tôi không được vào trại các người, vậy các người cũng đừng vào đây.
tr: "Işık yakmaya hakkım yok mu? Hadi, çık odamdan. Odanıza gelmemi istemiyorsunuz, ben de sizlerin odama gelmenizi istemiyorum.
es: —Bueno, tengo derecho a encender la luz. Tiene que marcharse de mi cuarto. A mí no me dejan estar en el barracón y yo no le dejaré estar aquí.
vi_translation: - Hmph, I have the right to light the lamp. Now step out. I'm not allowed into your camp, so you shouldn't come in here either.
tr_translation: "Don't I have the right to turn on the light? Come on, get out of my room. You don't want me to come to your room, and I don't want you to come to mine either."
es_translation: —Well, I have the right to turn on the light. You have to leave my room. They don't let me stay in the barrack and I won't let you stay here.

en: Crooks bored in on him. “Want me ta tell ya what’ll happen? They’ll take ya to the booby hatch. They’ll tie ya up with a collar, like a dog.”
vi: Crooks nhấn mạnh: - Chú muốn tôi nói tiếp cho mà nghe không. Tụi nó sẽ lôi cổ chú vào nhà thương điên. Rồi ở đó, tụi nó trói chú vào dây xích, như chó ấy.
tr: "Yalan söylüyorsun, George yaralanmadı. "Ne olacağını söyleyeyim mi, ben sana? Seni tımarhaneye götürürler. Köpek gibi bir tasma geçirirler boynuna.
es: Los ojos de Crooks perforaron los suyos. —¿Quiere que le diga lo que pasará? Lo llevarán al manicomio, lo atarán del pescuezo, como a un perro.
vi_translation: Crooks emphasized: - Do you want me to continue talking? They will drag you to the mental hospital. There, they will chain you up like a dog.
tr_translation: "You're lying, George wasn't injured."" "Shall I tell you what will happen? They will take you to the asylum. They will put a collar on your neck like a dog."
es_translation: Crooks' eyes bored into his. —Do you want me to tell you what will happen? They will take you to the asylum, they will tie you by the neck, like a dog.

en: The stable buck went on dreamily, “I remember when I was a little kid on my old man’s chicken ranch. Had two brothers. They was always near me, always there. Used to sleep right in the same room, right in the same bed—all three. Had a strawberry patch. Had an alfalfa patch. Used to turn the chickens out in the alfalfa on a sunny morning. My brothers’d set on a fence rail an’ watch ’em—white chickens they was.”
vi: Người mã phu mơ màng tiếp: - Tôi còn nhớ hồi nhỏ, ở trong trang trại nuôi gà vịt với cha tôi. Tôi có hai người anh, tụi tôi lúc nào cũng quanh quẩn với nhau. Cả ba người ở cùng một phòng, ngủ chung một giường. Trong trại có một vườn dâu và một góc trồng cỏ linh lăng. Sáng nào trời nắng ấm, tụi này lùa gà vào đám cỏ linh lăng. Các anh tôi dựng một hàng rào chung quanh và đứng ngắm... đàn gà trắng muốt.
tr: Seyis, hayallerine dalmış bir halde devam etti: "Hatırlıyorum, küçüktüm, babamın tavuk çiftliğindeydim. İki kardeşim vardı. Hep benimle beraber, yanımdaydılar. Üçümüz de aynı odada oturur, aynı yatakta yatardık... Bir çilek tarlamız, bir yonca çayırımız vardı. Güneş açtığı zamanlar, sabahları tavukları yoncaya salardık. Kardeşlerim kenarda durur, onlara gözkulak olurlardı... Ne beyazdı ya, tavuklar.
es: El peón del establo continuó con expresión soñadora: —Recuerdo cuando era chico, en la casa de mi padre. Tenía dos hermanos. Estaban siempre conmigo, siempre. Dormíamos en la misma habitación, en la misma cama, los tres. Teníamos un terreno con fresas. Teníamos un campo de alfalfa. En las mañanas soleadas solíamos soltar las gallinas en la alfalfa. Mis hermanos se sentaban en la alambrada para mirarlas: eran gallinas blancas.
vi_translation: The coachman dreamily continued: - I still remember when I was a child, living on a farm raising chickens and ducks with my father. I had two brothers, and we were always hanging around together. All three of us shared one room and slept in the same bed. On the farm, there was a strawberry garden and a corner where alfalfa was grown. Every sunny morning, we would herd the chickens into the alfalfa patch. My brothers would set up a fence around it and watch... the pure white chickens.
tr_translation: The groom continued, lost in his dreams: "I remember, I was small, I was at my father's chicken farm. I had two siblings. They were always with me, by my side. The three of us would sit in the same room, sleep in the same bed... We had a strawberry field, a clover meadow. When the sun was shining, in the mornings we would let the chickens out into the clover. My siblings would stand by the side, keeping an eye on them... How white they were, the chickens."
es_translation: The stable hand continued with a dreamy expression: —I remember when I was a child, in my father's house. I had two brothers. They were always with me, always. We slept in the same room, in the same bed, the three of us. We had a strawberry field. We had an alfalfa field. On sunny mornings, we used to let the chickens loose in the alfalfa. My brothers would sit on the fence to watch them: they were white chickens.

en: She regarded them amusedly. “Funny thing,” she said. “If I catch any one man, and he’s alone, I get along fine with him. But just let two of the guys get together an’ you won’t talk. Jus’ nothing but mad.” She dropped her fingers and put her hands on her hips. “You’re all scared of each other, that’s what. Ever’ one of you’s scared the rest is goin’ to get something on you.”
vi: Ả nhìn bọn họ, thích thú: - Thật là kỳ, khi tôi gặp người đàn ông nào một mình thì tôi luôn luôn ăn ý với họ. Nhưng cứ có hai người thì không thể nào cạy miệng ra được một lời. Chỉ biết nổi quạu thôi. Ả thôi không mân mê các ngón tay nữa và chống tay lên hông: Có gì đâu, các người sợ lẫn nhau. Các người sợ rằng người khác đi học lại.
tr: Kadın hoşlanmış bir tavırla onlara baktı: "Ne tuhaf," dedi. "Bir erkeği tek başına gördüğüm zaman onunla pekala anlaşıyorum. Ama ikiniz bir arada oldunuz mu, ağzınızdan tek laf alana aşkolsun. Hep homur homur homurdanırsınız. Parmaklarını bıraktı, ellerini kalçalarına dayadı: "Hepiniz birbirinizden korkarsınız, hep o yüzden. Hep başkaları hakkınızda dedikodu yapar diye ödünüz patlar.
es: Ella lo miró como divertida. —Es raro —dijo—. Si encuentro a un hombre, cualquiera, y está solo, me llevo muy bien con él. Pero en cuanto dos de vosotros estáis juntos, ya no queréis ni hablar. Os enfadáis y se acabó. Dejó caer los brazos y apoyó las manos en las caderas. —Todos os tenéis miedo, eso es lo que pasa. Todos tenéis miedo de que los demás os hagan algo.
vi_translation: She looked at them, amused: - It's strange, whenever I meet a man alone, I always get along with him. But as soon as there are two people, I can't get a word out. I just get annoyed. She stopped fiddling with her fingers and put her hands on her hips: What's the big deal, you are all afraid of each other. You are afraid that others will go back to school.
tr_translation: The woman looked at them with a pleased demeanor: "How strange," he said. "When I see a man alone, I get along with him just fine. But when the two of you are together, it's impossible to get a word out of you. You always grumble and mumble." He let go of his fingers and placed his hands on his hips: "You are all afraid of each other, that's always the reason. You are always terrified that others will gossip about you."
es_translation: She looked at him amusedly. —It's strange —he said—. If I find a man, any man, and he's alone, I get along very well with him. But as soon as two of you are together, you don't even want to talk. You get angry and that's the end of it. He let his arms fall and placed his hands on his hips. —You are all afraid, that's what it is. You are all afraid that others will do something to you.

en: From outside came the clang of horseshoes on the playing peg and the shouts of men, playing, encouraging, jeering. But in the barn it was quiet and humming and lazy and warm.
vi: Phía ngoài, thấy tiếng móng ngựa đập lên tấm sắt kêu chát chúa và tiếng người chơi cổ võ, chế nhạo. Nhưng trong chuồng ngựa vạn vật đều rì rầm, uể oải và nóng bức.
tr: Dışarda demir çubuğa çarpan nalların gürültüsü ile oynayan, birbirini teşvik eden, alaya alan adamların sesleri duyuluyordu. Ahırda ise ortalık sessiz, tembel, sıcak ve vızıltılı idi.
es: Desde fuera llegaba el tañido de las herraduras contra la estaca de juego y los clamores de los hombres, para jugar, para alentar, para mofarse. Pero en el granero había calma y zumbido y pereza y calor.
vi_translation: Outside, the sound of horse hooves striking the metal plate was loud and jarring, accompanied by the cheers and jeers of the crowd. But inside the stable, everything was murmuring, lethargic, and hot.
tr_translation: The noise of horseshoes striking the iron bar outside, and the voices of men playing, encouraging each other, and mocking were heard. In the stable, however, it was quiet, lazy, warm, and buzzing.
es_translation: From outside came the clanging of horseshoes against the stake and the shouts of men, to play, to cheer, to mock. But in the barn there was calm and buzzing and laziness and heat.

en: Suddenly his anger arose. “God damn you,” he cried. “Why do you got to get killed? You ain’t so little as mice.” He picked up the pup and hurled it from him. He turned his back on it. He sat bent over his knees and he whispered, “Now I won’t get to tend the rabbits. Now he won’t let me.” He rocked himself back and forth in his sorrow.
vi: Thốt nhiên nó kêu lên giận dữ: - Tại sao mày lại dễ chết vậy hả trời? Mày đâu có bé bỏng gì như con chuột. Nó nhặt con chó lên và ném tít ra xa. Nó quay lưng không nhìn nữa. Nó ngồi xuống co cao hai đầu gối lên, rên rỉ! - Giờ thì mình đếch được nuôi thỏ nữa rồi. Giờ thì ảnh đếch cho mình nuôi thỏ nữa rồi. Và, trong cơn thất vọng, nó lắc lư người từ trước ra sau.
tr: Birdenbire kızarak sesini yükseltti: "Ne diye ölüyorsun sanki? Fare kadar küçük de değilsin. Köpek yavrusunu alıp uzağa fırlattı. Arkasını döndü. Oturup dizlerini kaldırdı, söylendi: "Artık tavşanlara bakamayacağım ben. Artık tavşanlara bakmama izin vermeyecek, George. Üzüntüsünden ileri geri sallanıyordu.
es: De pronto, explotó su ira. —¡Maldito seas! —exclamó—. ¿Por qué has tenido que ir y morirte? No eres tan pequeño como los ratones. Levantó el perrito y lo arrojó a lo lejos. Le volvió la espalda. Se sentó, muy inclinado el busto sobre las rodillas, y murmuró: —Ahora no van a dejar que cuide de los conejos. Ahora George no me va a dejar. Se inclinó hacia adelante y atrás, meciéndose en su desventura.
vi_translation: Suddenly, he cried out angrily: - Why are you so easy to die, oh heavens? You're not as small as a mouse. It picked up the dog and threw it far away. It turned its back and didn't look anymore. It sat down, pulling its knees up, and groaned! - Now I damn well can't raise rabbits anymore. Now he damn well won't let me raise rabbits anymore. And, in a fit of despair, he rocked himself back and forth.
tr_translation: Suddenly, raising his voice in anger: "Why are you dying as if? You're not as small as a mouse." He picked up the puppy and threw it far away. He turned his back. He sat down and lifted his knees, muttering: "I won't be able to look after the rabbits anymore. George won't let me look after the rabbits anymore." He was rocking back and forth out of sorrow.
es_translation: Suddenly, his anger exploded. —Damn you! —he exclaimed—. Why did you have to go and die? You are not as small as the mice. He picked up the puppy and threw it far away. He turned his back on him. He sat down, his torso bent over his knees, and murmured: —Now they won't let me take care of the rabbits. Now George won't let me. He leaned forward and backward, rocking in his misfortune.

en: She consoled him. “Don’t you worry none. He was jus’ a mutt. You can get another one easy. The whole country is fulla mutts.”
vi: Ả an ủi: - Thôi ăn thua gì. Con chó con ấy mà. Kiếm một con khác dễ ợt. Chó thì không thiếu gì ở vùng này.
tr: Kadın onu teselli etti: "Üzüldüğün şeye bak. it yavrusu işte, ne olacak. Bir başkasını bulmak zor değil ya. it yavrusu dolu her taraf.
es: —No te aflijas —le consoló la mujer—. Era un perrito cualquiera. Puedes conseguir otro en cualquier parte. Los hay a montones.
vi_translation: She comforted: - It's no big deal. Just a puppy. Finding another one is a piece of cake. There are plenty of dogs in this area.
tr_translation: The woman comforted him: "Look at what you're upset about. It's just a puppy, so what. It's not hard to find another one. The place is full of puppies."
es_translation: —Don't be upset —the woman consoled him—. It was just an ordinary puppy. You can get another one anywhere. There are plenty of them.

en: She was a little bit reassured. “Well, who don’t?” she said. “Ever’body likes that. I like to feel silk an’ velvet. Do you like to feel velvet?”
vi: Ả hơi vững tâm trở lại. Ả nói: - Ai cũng vậy mà. Ai cũng thích vậy. Tôi ý à, tôi thích sờ vào nhung lụa. Anh có thích sờ vào nhung không?
tr: Kadının korkusu biraz yatışmıştı: "Herkes sever onu," dedi. "Herkes sever. Ben ipek ve kadifeye dokunmaya bayılırım. Sen kadifeye dokunmasını sever misin?
es: —Bueno —dijo la mujer, algo tranquilizada—, ¿a quién no le gusta? A todo el mundo le gusta. A mí me gusta acariciar la seda y el terciopelo. ¿A ti te gusta tocar terciopelo?
vi_translation: She regained her composure. She said: - Everyone is like that. Everyone likes that. Me, I like touching velvet and silk. Do you like touching velvet?
tr_translation: The woman's fear had somewhat subsided: "Everyone loves him," he said. "Everyone loves. I love to touch silk and velvet. Do you like touching velvet?"
es_translation: —Well —said the woman, somewhat reassured—, who doesn't like it? Everyone likes it. I like to caress silk and velvet. Do you like to touch velvet?

en: As happens sometimes, a moment settled and hovered and remained for much more than a moment. And sound stopped and movement stopped for much, much more than a moment.
vi: Như một đôi khi vẫn xảy ra, thời giờ như đi chậm lại, kéo dài hơn mọi ngày. Và, mọi tiếng động đều ngưng lại, và mọi cử động đều dừng lại trong vài phút, vài phút nhưng lâu hơn cả hàng mấy mươi phút.
tr: Arasıra olduğu gibi dakikalar uzadı, dakikalardan daha uzun sürer oldu. Dakikalardan çok daha uzun birkaç dakika, bütün sesler kesildi, hiçbir şey kımıldamadı.
es: Como a veces ocurre, en un momento dado el tiempo se detuvo y ese momento duró más que cualquier otro. Y el sonido se detuvo, y el momento se detuvo durante mucho tiempo, mucho más tiempo que un momento.
vi_translation: As sometimes happens, time seemed to slow down, stretching longer than usual. And, all sounds ceased, and all movements stopped for a few minutes, a few minutes but longer than several tens of minutes.
tr_translation: As it sometimes happens, the minutes stretched out, becoming longer than the minutes themselves. A few minutes much longer than the minutes, all sounds ceased, nothing moved.
es_translation: As sometimes happens, at a given moment time stopped and that moment lasted longer than any other. And the sound stopped, and the moment lasted for a long time, much longer than a moment.

en: Then gradually time awakened again and moved sluggishly on. The horses stamped on the other side of the feeding racks and the halter chains clinked. Outside, the men’s voices became louder and clearer.
vi: Rồi dần dần thời gian bừng giấc và tiếp tục trôi một cách uể oải. Đàn ngựa dậm chân phía bên kia máng cỏ. Tiếng dây cương kêu loảng xoảng. Bên ngoài, tiếng người nghe lớn hơn rõ hơn.
tr: Yavaş yavaş zaman uyandı ve tembel tembel seyrine devam etti. Yemliklerin öbür tarafından atlar tepişti, zincirler şıkırdadı. Dışardan adamların sesleri daha yüksek, daha açık duyulmaya başladı.
es: Luego, gradualmente, despertó otra vez el tiempo y prosiguió perezosamente su marcha. Los caballos golpearon los cascos del otro lado de los pesebres e hicieron sonar las cadenas de los ronzales. Fuera, las voces de los hombres se hicieron más fuertes y más claras.
vi_translation: Then gradually, time awoke and continued to flow sluggishly. The horses stomped their feet on the other side of the trough. The sound of the reins clinked. Outside, the voices sounded louder and clearer.
tr_translation: Slowly, time woke up and lazily continued its course. From the other side of the mangers, the horses kicked, and chains clinked. From outside, the voices of men began to be heard more clearly and loudly.
es_translation: Then, gradually, time awoke again and lazily continued its march. The horses struck their hooves on the other side of the mangers and made the bridle chains rattle. Outside, the voices of the men grew louder and clearer.

en: When she didn’t answer, he stepped nearer. “You oughten to sleep out here,” he said disapprovingly; and then he was beside her and—“Oh, Jesus Christ!” He looked about helplessly, and he rubbed his beard. And then he jumped up and went quickly out of the barn.
vi: Không thấy trả lời, lão tiến lại gần. Lão nói với giọng trách mắng: - Sao cô lại xuống đây mà ngủ. Một lát sau, lão ở sát cạnh ả và... “Trời!”. Lão cuống cuồng vừa nhìn chung quanh, vừa gãi râu. Rồi lão nhảy phắt lên và lao ra khỏi trại ngựa.
tr: Cevap alamayınca, yaklaştı. Çıkıştı: "Burada uyumanız doğru değil." Bir an sonra kadının yanına gelmişti. "Vay anasını!" dedi. Sakalını kaşıyarak şaşkın şaşkın etrafına bakındı. Sonra yerinden fırlayarak dışarı kaçtı.
es: Al no obtener respuesta, se acercó más. —No debería dormir aquí —expresó con desaprobación; y entonces llegó a su altura y... —. ¡Oh, Dios! —Miró a su alrededor, azorado, y se frotó la barba. Luego saltó y salió rápidamente del granero.
vi_translation: . Not hearing a response, he moved closer. He spoke in a reproachful tone: - Why did you come down here to sleep? A moment later, the old man was right next to her and... "Heavens!". The old man frantically looked around while scratching his beard. Then he suddenly jumped up and dashed out of the horse camp.
tr_translation: When he didn't get an answer, he approached. He snapped: "It's not right for you to sleep here." A moment later, he had come to the woman's side. "Wow!" he said. He scratched his beard and looked around in astonishment. Then he jumped up and ran outside.
es_translation: Not getting a response, he moved closer. —You shouldn't sleep here —he expressed with disapproval; and then he reached his height and... —. Oh, God! —He looked around, bewildered, and rubbed his beard. Then he jumped and quickly left the barn.

en: The sound of the men grew fainter. The barn was darkening gradually and, in their stalls, the horses shifted their feet and rattled the halter chains. Old Candy lay down in the hay and covered his eyes with his arm.
vi: Tiếng người tắt ngấm. Trại ngựa tối dần và trong các ô, đàn ngựa cọ chân làm kêu loảng xoảng bộ dây cương. Lão Candy nằm xuống đống rạ và lấy cánh tay che mắt.
tr: Adamların sesi kayboldu. Ahır, gitgide kararıyordu; hayvanlar bölmelerinde eşiniyor, zincirlerini şıngırdatıyorlardı. İhtiyar Candy otlara yattı, gözlerini kollarıyla kapadı.
es: El ruido de los pasos de los hombres se hizo más lejano. El granero se oscurecía gradualmente y, en sus pesebres, los caballos movían las patas y hacían sonar las cadenas de los ronzales. El viejo Candy se tendió en el heno y se cubrió los ojos con un brazo.
vi_translation: The sound of people ceased. The horse camp gradually darkened, and in the stalls, the horses scraped their hooves, making the harnesses clink. Old Candy lay down on the straw and covered his eyes with his arm.
tr_translation: The men's voices faded away. The barn was gradually getting darker; the animals were rustling in their stalls, clinking their chains. Old Candy lay down on the hay, covering his eyes with his arms.
es_translation: The sound of the men's footsteps grew more distant. The barn gradually darkened and, in their stalls, the horses moved their legs and made the chains of their bridles clink. Old Candy lay down in the hay and covered his eyes with an arm.

en: The deep green pool of the Salinas River was still in the late afternoon. Already the sun had left the valley to go climbing up the slopes of the Gabilan mountains, and the hilltops were rosy in the sun. But by the pool among the mottled sycamores, a pleasant shade had fallen.
vi: Trời về, chiều, dòng nước Salinas ngủ lặng lờ, sâu thẳm và xanh. Ánh mặt trời đã rời khỏi thung lũng và leo lên sườn dãy núi Gabilan,và đỉnh núi đỏ hồng ánh nắng. Nhưng, gần mặt nước chìm đọng, khoảng giữa những cây sung nổi vân, mọi vật chìm đắm trong bóng râm êm mát.
tr: O ikindi sonu, Salinas deresinin suyu, derin, sakin, yemyeşil uyuyordu. Güneş artık vadiden çekilmiş, Galiban dağlarının sırtlarını tırmanıyordu, yüksek tepeler güneşten al aldı. Fakat durgun suyun kenarında, benekli frenk çınarlarının arasında loş bir karanlık hüküm sürüyordu.
es: La honda laguna verde del río Salinas estaba muy calmada a la caída de la tarde. El sol había dejado ya el valle para ir trepando por las laderas de las montañas Gabilán, y las cumbres estaban rosadas de sol. Pero junto a la laguna, entre los veteados sicómoros, había caído una sombra placentera.
vi_translation: Evening falls, the Salinas River flows quietly, deep and blue. The sunlight has left the valley and climbed up the slopes of the Gabilan Mountains, and the mountain peaks glow with a rosy hue. However, near the still water's surface, amidst the trees with visible veins, everything was immersed in cool, soothing shade.
tr_translation: That late afternoon, the water of the Salinas creek was deep, calm, and lush green, sleeping. The sun had now withdrawn from the valley and was climbing the ridges of the Galiban mountains; the high peaks were glowing red from the sun. But along the edge of the still water, amidst the speckled sycamores, a dim darkness prevailed.
es_translation: The deep green lagoon of the Salinas River was very calm at the fall of the evening. The sun had already left the valley to climb up the slopes of the Gabilan Mountains, and the peaks were pink with sunlight. But by the lagoon, among the veined sycamores, a pleasant shadow had fallen.

en: A far rush of wind sounded and a gust drove through the tops of the trees like a wave. The sycamore leaves turned up their silver sides, the brown, dry leaves on the ground scudded a few feet. And row on row of tiny wind waves flowed up the pool’s green surface.
vi: Một tràng súng dội lại từ xa và cơn gió lay động các chòm cây như một đợt sóng. Đám lá sung phô ra mặt ánh bạc. Dưới đất, đám lá vàng bị thổi bay vài thước. Và từng cơn một. những luồng gió nhẹ khẽ làm gợn làn nước xanh.
